00016 // .NAME vtkRemoveCellsFilter- actually remove a cell from a vtkPolyData object
00017 // .SECTION Description
00018 // vtkRemoveCellsFilter removes cells one at a time. vtkCellPicker could be used to get the CellId of the cell to
00019 // be removed. Then call the RemoveCell method with the CellId. The UndoRemoveCells method restores the 
00020 // PolyData to it original state. Alternatively, you can mark cells with MarkCell and remove them all in one go
00021 // with RemoveMarkedCells. This is much more efficient for large datasets since the filter only has to execute
00022 // once.
00023 
00024 // .SECTION Caveats
00025 // Trying to remove the last remaining cell in a dataset will restore all the removed cells!
00026 // Any filter between this filter and the vtkPolyDataMapper should not alter the cell order
00027 
00028 
00029 // .SECTION Thanks
00030 // Goodwin Lawlor, University College Dublin
00031 
00032 
00033 #ifndef __vtkRemoveCellsFilter_h
00034 #define __vtkRemoveCellsFilter_h
00035 
00036 #include "vtkCellsFilter.h"
00037 // #include "vtkIdList.h"
00038 // #include "vtkCharArray.h"
00039 // #include "vtkPolyData.h"
00040 #include "vtkBioengConfigure.h" // Include configuration header.
00041 
00042 class vtkLookupTable;
00043 
00044 class VTK_BIOENG_EXPORT vtkRemoveCellsFilter : public vtkCellsFilter
00045 {
00046 public:
00047   // Description:
00048   // Constructs with initial values of zero.
00049   static vtkRemoveCellsFilter *New();
00050 
00051   vtkTypeRevisionMacro(vtkRemoveCellsFilter, vtkCellsFilter);
00052   void PrintSelf(ostream& os, vtkIndent indent);
00053   
00054   // Description:
00055   // Remove a cell from the input polydata.  cellid is a cell id from the input to the filter
00056   // A recursive trick remaps the new cellids (from the output) to the old cellids (at the input) 
00057   // so that the cellid returned by vtkCellPicker is the correct one to use.
00058  void RemoveCell(vtkIdType cellid);
00059  
00060   // Description:
00061   // Remove the cells marked by MarkCell(cellid)
00062  void RemoveMarkedCells();
00063  
00064 //   // Description:
00065 //   // Remove everything but the cells marked by MarkCell(cellid) or ToggleCells(cellid)
00066 //   void RemoveUnmarkedCells();
00067  
00068  // Description:
00069  // Undo all the remove operations 
00070  void UndoRemoveCells(){this->Initialize(); this->Modified();}
00071  
00072 
00073  // Desciption:
00074  // Get the number of cells that have been removed. GetNumberOfDeletedCells should be depreciated.
00075  int GetNumberOfDeletedCells(){return this->GetPolyDataInput(0)->GetNumberOfCells() - vtkPolyData::SafeDownCast(this->GetOutput())->GetNumberOfCells();}
00076  int GetNumberOfRemovedCells(){return this->GetPolyDataInput(0)->GetNumberOfCells() - vtkPolyData::SafeDownCast(this->GetOutput())->GetNumberOfCells();} 
00077 
00078 
00079 
00080 protected:
00081   vtkRemoveCellsFilter(){};
00082   ~vtkRemoveCellsFilter(){};
00083   
00084 
00085 private:
00086   vtkRemoveCellsFilter(const vtkRemoveCellsFilter&);  // Not implemented.
00087   void operator=(const vtkRemoveCellsFilter&);  // Not implemented.
00088 };
00089 
00090 #endif
